src_text: Maemo a kabinete ka ga merero ye e lego ditabeng ka seemong sa bjale Kabinete e ipilet a go dit haba go ba kgahlanong le dikgaruru t a bosenyi ka ga kgonagalo ya go bonala gape ga dikgaruru t a bosenyi t e di lebi it wego go bat wantl Kabinete e hlokomet e gore e se ke ya bona dikgaruru t e bjalo ka lehloyo la bat wantle ka gobane bohlatse bjo bo t welet ego peleng bo laet a gore ditiro t e di ka be di bakwa ke boseny Kabinete e retile dihlongwa t a phethagat o ya molao ka ga kgato ya t ona ya ka pela le ya sephetho yeo di e t ereg Kabinete e lebi a mahloko a yona go ba malapa le bagwera ba masogana ao a hlokofet ego ka lebaka la lebollo la dikoma leo le sego maleb Kabinete e thekga boipilet o bjo bo dirilwego ke Mopresidente Jacob Zuma gore go dirwe toka ya ka pela ebile e ipilet a go baetapele ba set o le maloko a set haba go ba kgahlanong le tlai o ye goba kgahlanong le go hloka
trg_text: Working Together for Youth Development and a Drug Free South Afric Government s decisive action to address substance abuse in Eldorado Park, Gauteng, brings the people in this area closer to the realisation of a drug-free communit Cabinet notes and welcomes the progress made by the police, community leaders and other structures in Eldorado Park under the leadership of the Gauteng Provincial Governmen Together they made significant progress in fighting the scourge of substance abus Cabinet is aware that the situation in Eldorado Park is symptomatic of issues facing many communities in the rest of the country and calls on communities throughout the country to lead the fight for a

src_text: edMmu o o thekga ka botlalo ditlwaedi le dit o t a set haba sa rena se se farologanego gomme ebile o bolela gore dilo t e di swanet e go lekalekanywa le ditokelo t a molaothe Kabinete e amoget e go kgatha tema ga Afrika Borwa ka Samiting ye e sa t wago go swarwa ya Mokgatlo wa Dinagakopano t a Afrika (AU), fao Afrika Borwa e beilego dilo t e mmalwa pele t e di bego di le lenaneotherong la Samit T ona di akaredit e Leanot homo la Khomi ene ya AU la lebaka la nako la 2014-2017 le Ditekanyet o t a AU t a 2014; seemo sa khut o le t hirelet ego ka Afrika; methopo ye mengwe ya thekgo ya ma eleng go AU; Lenaneotlhabolo la ka morago ga 2015; kopano ya Dihlogo t a Dinaga t a Selekane se Seswa ka ga Tlhabollo ya Afrika le Komiti ya Tlwaet o ya Mmu o, le Samiti ya Foramo ya Mokgwa wa Tekodi i o ya Sethaka wa Afrik Kabinete e retile boetapele bja Mokgatlo wa Dinaga t e di Hlabollogago t a Borwa bja Afrika ge bo nolofadit e tshepedi o ye e feledit ego ka gore Zimbabwe e amogele Molaotheo o mosw Molatheo wa Zimbabwe o bopa kgatelopele e bohlokwa ka katlegong ya phethagat o ya Tumelelano ya Khut o Lefaseng ka bophar
trg_text: Cabinet conveys its condolences to the families and friends of the young men who lost their lives as a result of inappropriate initiation ceremonie Cabinet endorses the call by President Jacob Zuma for swift justice and calls on traditional leaders and members of the community to be vigilant against abuse or neglecGovernment fully supports the traditions and cultures of our diverse society and highlights that these must be balanced with constitutional right Cabinet welcomed South Africa s participation in the recent African Union (AU) Summit, where South Africa prioritised a number of issues on the agenda of the Summi These included the Strategic Plan of the AU Commission for the period 2014-2017 and the AU Budget for 2014; the state of peace and security in Africa; alternative sources of funding for the AU; the post-2015 Development Agenda; the meeting of the NEPAD Heads of State and Government Orientation Committee, and the African Peer Review Mechanism (APRM) Forum Summi Cabinet commended the Southern African Development Community (SADC) leadership for facilitating the process that led to Zimbabwe adopting a new Constitutio The Zimbabwean Constitution marks a significant milestone in the successful implementation of the Global Peace Agreemen

trg_text: Cabinet also expressed deep sorrow at the death of five learners from Lwandile Village in Ngqeleni, Eastern Cape, who died in a bus acciden 30 learners were also injured during this tragic inciden Government offers its condolences to the families, friends, fellow learners and educators of the victim

src_text: Kabinete e lemoga le go amogela kgatelopele ye e dirilwego ke maphodisa, baetapele ba set haba le makala a mangwe ka Eldorado Park ka fase ga boetapele bja Mmu o wa Profense wa Gauten Mmogo di dirile kgatelopele e kgolo ka go lwant ha leuba la t homi obo aedi ya diokobat
trg_text: Cabinet is saddened by the passing of veteran journalist Vuyo Mbuli and offers condolences to the Mbuli family, friends and colleagues in the media industr Mr Mbuli had contributed immensely to shaping the national discourse on key issues and his passion for his work had touched the hearts of South African Cabinet expressed its deepest condolences to the citizens of Bangladesh and families and friends of over 1 000 garment factory workers who died when a building collapse Our thoughts and prayers are with the people of Banglades.

src_text: ka mafelong a t onKa kgwedi ya Bafsa, a re ikgafeng leswa go lwa ntwa kgahlanong le t homi obo aedi ya diokobat i le botagwa ka mafelong ka moka a ka nagen Kabinete e amogela go tsebagat wa mo go oket egilego ga go rutwa ga dipolelo t a Afrika ka go Kreiti ya R le ka go Kreiti ya 1 fao e lego gore dipolelo t e ga se t a hlwa di rutwKabinete e reta gape go tsebagat a ga Yunibesithi ya KwaZulu-Natal gore e dira gore Sezulu e be thuto ye e gapelet wago go rutwa go baithuti bao ba ithutelago dithuto t a kgrata go bao ba sa tsebego Sezulu, go ingwadi et a thuto ya Sezulu gore ba be le bokgoni bja go e bolelKabinete e hlohlelet a maAfrika Borwa ka moka go ithuta polelo ya setlogo ya seAfrika ka ge se se t wet a pele gore batho ba bolele dipolelo t e nt i le go aga set hab Kabinete e hlagi it e gore go thoma ka la 1 go fihla ka la 3 Phupu 2013 Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o tla ya Japane ka ketelo ya semmu o gomme a tsenela Khonferentshe ya Bodi habat haba ya Tokyo ya bo 5 ka ga Tlhabollo ya Afrika (TICAD V).
trg_text: South Africa within their respective areaDuring Youth Month, let us recommit ourselves to fighting the war against substance abuse and alcoholism in all areas of the countr Cabinet welcomes the incremental introduction of an African language in Grade R and Grade 1 where such languages are not yet offereCabinet also commends the announcement by the University of KwaZulu-Natal to make isiZulu compulsory for undergraduate students, who are not proficient in isiZulu, to register for a course to develop conversational skillCabinet encourages all South Africans to learn an indigenous language as it promotes multilingualism and fosters nation-buildin Cabinet notes that from 1 to 3 June 2013 President Jacob Zuma will pay an official visit to Japan and attend the 5th Tokyo International Conference on African Development (TICAD V).

src_text: Kabinete e nyami wa ke go hlokofala ga moga i wa ditaba yo a nago le maitemogelo Vuyo Mbuli gomme e lebi a mahloko go ba lapa la Mbuli, go bagwera le go ba omimmogo ba gagwe ka intastering ya kga
trg_text: This aims to ultimately position the SAPS to respond to a constantly evolving criminal landscape while simultaneously meeting the needs of a developmental stat Cabinet approved the National Plan of Action for Children 2012-2017 as the comprehensive plan to give guidance and direction to government departments, civil society and other partners in the children s sector towards the realisation of children s rightThe plan embraces the Constitution, international and regional treaties, the emerging legislation on children in South Africa, Millennium Development Goals and the National Development Plan Vision 2030.The plan has five main themes: child survival ( reduction of child mortality); child development ( early childhood development services); child protection ( protection from violence and sexual abuse); standard of living of children ( conditions on accommodation for children) and child participation ( children taking responsibility while enjoying their rights).This National Plan of Action for Children 2012-2017 will be further unpacked during a separate media briefin

src_text: Morena Mbuli o t wet e pele kudu ka go otlolla theri ano ya boset haba ya mabapi le merero e bohlokwa gomme go rata ga gagwe ga mo omo wa gagwe go amile dipelo t a maAfrika Borw Kabinete e lebi it e mahloko a yona a magolo go badudi ba Bangladesh le go ba malapa le bagwera ba ba omi ba go feta ba 1 000 ba feme ya go dira diaparo bao ba hlokofet ego ge moago o phuhlam Dikgopolo le dithapelo t a rena di lebi it we go batho ba Banglades.
trg_text: It is a sad moment when South Africa loses future leaders Key Cabinet discussions and decisions Cabinet approved that the Green Paper on Policing be published in the Government Gazette for public commentSince the establishment of the South African Police Service (SAPS) in 1994, there have been many changes in the internal and external environment that have impacted on the Service s understanding of and response to issues of crime and safetPost-1994, government was faced with addressing the twin objectives of creating a developmental state while also transforming the police into an institution of governancThis Green Paper responds to the challenges identified following an assessment of the relevance of the 1996 Crime Prevention Strategy (NCPS) and the 1998 White paper on Safety and Securit Embedded in these policies was the notion of addressing safety and security in a holistic manner through the development and implementation of integrated cross-sectoral programme Together they sought to put in place a comprehensive framework for dealing with broader issues of safety and security until 2004.The Green Paper deals with

trg_text: and as executive member on its Board of Directors for a period of one yea Mr Trevor Gordon as Deputy Director-General: Chemicals and Waste Management in the Department of Environmental Affair Ms Yoliswa Makhasi as Deputy Director-General: Corporate Management in the Department of Public Enterprise Ms Rose Mbono as Deputy Director-General: Economic Impact and Policy Alignment in the Department of Public Enterprise Cabinet approved the following appointments at the South African Social Security Agency (SASSA):a) Ms Emmarentia Dianne Dunkerley to the post of Executive Manager: Grants Administration,b) M Frank Earl to the post of Executive Manager: Grants Benefits Transfe Cabinet noted the extension of the term of office, by a period of six months, for the 20 members of the current Council of the South African Council for the Natural Scientific Professions until 30 September 2013.Issued by Government Communications (GCIS)Enquiries: Phumla Williams (Acting Cabinet Spokesperson)Contact: 083 501 0139

trg_text: Cabinet approved that the Charter for African Cultural Renaissance be submitted to Parliament for approval of ratification in terms of Section 231 (92) of the Constitution of the Republic of South AfricThe ratification of the Charter by government is a response to the Declaration on Cultural Renaissance and Shared Values of the 16th Ordinary Session of the African Union (AU) Heads of State and Government held in Equatorial Guinea, January 2011, and the Launch of the AU campaign on the Charter for African Cultural Renaissance which took place in late 2011 in South AfricRatification of the Charter enhances protection of African cultural values and cultural heritage and promotes the spirit of Pan-AfricanisThe Charter promotes the unification of culture, arts, cultural values, language, heritage as well as cultural and creative industries as central to sustainable developmen This has the potential to contribute to the growth of the economy and social cohesio The Charter is aligned to the New Growth Path, the National Development Plan, the White Paper on Arts, Culture and Heritage and the Mzansi Golden Economy Strateg The Minster of Arts and Culture will host a media briefing in this regar Cabinet noted the hosting of the first Science, Technology and Innovation Summit from 20 to 21 July 2013.The planned dialogue during the Summit provides a platform to explore ways to enhance coordination between government and the private sectoThe Summit will enable participants to explore ways in which science, technology and innovation (STI) can play a significant role in our journey towards a knowledge-based economy and realisation of Vision 203 Bills Cabinet approved the proposed amendments to the Draft Public Administration Management (PAM) Bill which will now be published for public commenThe draft Bill seeks to create a uniform legal framework for human resources and certain organisational and governance matters in national, provincial and municipal administration This is aimed at enhancing service delivery through a uniform system of public administration, improved utilisation of staff and the creation of a single door to government services for citizen Cabinet approved the Public Service Commission Amendment Bill for public comment and the introduction of the Amendment Bill in ParliamenThe purpose of the Amendment Bill is to align the Public Service Commission Act of 1997 with the Constitutio It further seeks to empower the Public Service Commission to give directions relating to the principles that govern public administratioThis is in line with the strengthened role envisaged by the National Development Plan for the Commissio Cabinet approved that the South African Weather Service Amendment Bill 2013 be published for public commenThis Amendment Bill seeks to amend the South African Weather Services Act, 2001 (Act N 08 of 2001) which provides for the establishment, objectives, powers and functions of the South African Weather ServicIn the main the amendments will provide the South African Weather Service with a legal mandate to implement the ambient air quality information management function, and to act as a custodian of the South African Air Quality information SysteThis contributes towards protecting and enhancing our environmental assets and natural resource Cabinet approved that the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Draft Amendment Bill, 2012 be submitted to ParliamenThe Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Draft Amendment Bill 2012 (Draft Bill) seeks to amend the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act, 2002 (Act N 28 of 2002) as amended by the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Amendment Act, 2008 (Act N 49 of 2008).The primary objectives of the draft Amendment Bill is, among others, to enhance provision for the beneficiation of minerals in order to promote industrialisation and contribute towards the nation s objectives of job creation and economic growth as envisaged in the National Development Pla A separate media briefing will be dedicated to this development
